name: Garlic Smashed Potatoes
description: You are going to love these garlic smashed potatoes! They're super garlicky, crispy on the outside, and fluffy on the inside. And the recipe is so easy! I love serving these smashed potatoes as an easy dinner with a big salad and vegan sour cream or as a festive side dish at a family meal.

recipeInstructions.text: Boil the potatoes for 30 minutes. Let them cool in a colander for about 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Boil the potatoes for 30 minutes. Let them cool in a colander for about 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and place the cooked potatoes on top. Use a potato masher to squish them. Make sure to keep them in one piece.
recipeInstructions.name: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and place the cooked potatoes on top. Use a potato masher to squish them. Make sure to keep them in one piece.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the olive oil, the minced garlic, the chopped parsley, salt, and black pepper in a small bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine the olive oil, the minced garlic, the chopped parsley, salt, and black pepper in a small bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the mixture over each potato. Add some more sea salt on top. Preheat your oven to 350 °F.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour the mixture over each potato. Add some more sea salt on top. Preheat your oven to 350 °F.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake the potatoes for 25 minutes until they're golden and crispy. If you want them to be even crispier, you can also bake them for up to 30 to 35 minutes. But make sure they don't get too brown.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake the potatoes for 25 minutes until they're golden and crispy. If you want them to be even crispier, you can also bake them for up to 30 to 35 minutes. But make sure they don't get too brown.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately. Season with a little bit of additional salt and freshly chopped parsley. Enjoy!
